thread.title: Chinese international fined and dropped for stamping on Axel Witsel in Super League clash
thread.title_full: Chinese international fined and dropped for stamping on Axel Witsel in Super League clash

author: jgordon
title: Chinese international fined and dropped for stamping on Axel Witsel in Super League clash
text:
stamp ace gets ax Chinese international fined and dropped for stamping on Axel Witsel in Super League clash 
Shanghai Shenhua chairman took dim view of incident and is even threatening to slash star's wages as punishment By Jamie Gordon CHINESE international Qin Sheng has been hit with an extreme punishment for stamping on Axel Witsel. 
The midfielder was fined £35,000, relegated to the reserves and threatened with a wage cut. Sky Sports 3 Qin Sheng stamps on Axel Witsel’s foot with the score at 0-0 
Qin was sent off after deliberately standing on Witsel’s foot in Shanghai Shenhua’s 1-1 Chinese Super League draw with Tianjin Quanjian. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Chinese Super League news, gossip and rumours 
He has previous after fracturing Zlatan Muslimovic’s nose with a kick to the face in 2013 and seeing red for clattering Jonathan de Guzman in an international friendly the same year. 
A Shenhua statement said: “In the 24th minute, Greenland Shenhua player Qin Sheng deliberately stamped on the foot of his opponent in the box, and was shown a red card by the referee. His behaviour was against sportsmanship. MOST READ IN SPORT CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Hilarious moment Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp for interrupting his expert analysis on Sky Sports Team News Chelsea vs Manchester United team news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic ruled out of key FA Cup clash through suspension Red Mist Marcos Rojo facing retrospective FA ban after appearing to stamp on Chelsea's Eden Hazard during FA Cup clash at Stamford Bridge 2 Ron Rons Cristiano Ronaldo 'to be dad of twins' as surrogate mother revealed to be expecting 'very soon' CLASH FOR RASH Marcus Rashford IS with the Manchester United squad... but remains a doubt for Chelsea FA Cup tie HOOVER THE MOON Lincoln CLEANED UP the Emirates dressing room after making history with run to the FA Cup quarter-final Future Unshaw Luke Shaw travelled to London with Man United team but didn't even make bench for FA Cup quarter-final WHiTE HART SHAME Shock moment Millwall fan PUNCHES singing Spurs fan as derby is marred by violence 'THEY ARE TOO STRONG' SunSport experts have their say on Chelsea vs Manchester United as Jose Mourinho looks to avenge drubbing GO TO GUEYE Idrissa Gueye wanted by Arsenal for summer transfer as they look to make Everton star their midfield engine MAN VS HORSE Former GB sprinter Dwain Chambers takes on steed Heat Storm over 100 metres at Cheltenham to settle the age-old debate once and for all - so who is your money on? HIT THE ROAD Jack Wilshere facing more rejection with Bournemouth losing interest in making loan from Arsenal permanent 
“The club will see his attitude and follow-up performances, and decide whether to cut his annual salary. 
“When purchasing competitive achievements, the club will not loosen its management over players. We will take this as a lesson and avoid incidents like this.” 
Despite playing with 10 men, Shenhua opened the scoring in the 74th minute but Witsel equalised 10 minutes later. Axel Witsel snubs Juve for big money move to China's Tianjin Quanjian 
Qin was ordered to make a public apology after the awful challenge on one of the league's biggest stars. 
He said: "Exciting match but stupid foul. 
"My personal behaviour affected the whole team. I want to apologise to the fans, club officials and coaches, as well as my pals fighting together on the pitch. 
"As a professional player, I should not take such 'revenge' but respect the referee's decision." Sky Sports The midfielder was sent off but that was just the start of his punishments Getty Images 3 Witsel recovered from the stamp to score a late equaliser 
The club's President Wu Xiaohui added: "The extremely irrational behaviour of Qin Sheng has severely tarnished the image of this club, the football of Shanghai and even Chinese football. 
"All the efforts made by others have gone down the drain because of him. 
"Given Qin Sheng was shown a yellow card in the season opener, we intentionally warned him over his poor on-field behaviour before the game. However, our repeated warnings have not prevented this happening. 
"I don't think he was just caught up in the heat of the moment. Instead, it's a flagrant violation of the club management." Chelsea target Axel Witsel puts on a show for Zenit against Tosno
